source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第六十
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 60

source_sentence: 隋天竺三藏闍那崛多譯
translation: Sui Tianzhu Tripiṭaka Jñānagupta Translation

source_sentence: 摩尼婁陀品下
translation: Second Chapter of the Maṇilutra Sutra

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸比丘言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: At that point, the Buddha addressed the monks, saying, "You monks!

source_sentence: 彼時賊人在於辟支佛塔之前，益燈明者，其人是誰？
translation: Who was the thief who was in front of the pratyekabuddha-stūpa and gave it a lamp?

source_sentence: 莫作異見，摩尼婁陀比丘是也。
translation: Don't take it differently, for this is the monk Mānilūta.

source_sentence: 摩尼婁陀，往昔作於大居士子，名曰大財，於後復作行賊盜人，為辟支佛舍利塔中，添益燈油，以清淨心，乞如是願：『願我來世，莫生惡道。』
translation: In the past, Manilūṭa was a son of a great householder named Mahākauṣṭhila who later became a thief and stole from the tower of Pārśva's relics, adding lamp oil to it and asking with a pure heart, 'May I not be born in a bad path in a future life.'

source_sentence: 由彼業報，生世不曾墮惡道中，恒於天人，往反受樂。
translation: As a result of that karmic retribution, I'll never fall into a bad path in my lifetime and will always go to gods and humans and experience pleasure.

source_sentence: 而於彼時，復乞是願：『願我來世，恒常值遇如是世尊，或勝此者，彼所說法，願我速解。』
translation: At the time, he also begged this vow, 'May I always meet such a world-honored one in the next life, or may he be better than this one, and may he teach me a lesson that I'll quickly understand.'

source_sentence: 由彼業報，今得值我如是世尊，復於我邊，獲得出家，受具足戒。
translation: As a result of that karmic reward, I've now become worthy of such a Bhagavān, and I've again attained emancipation and full ordination at my side.

source_sentence: 而於彼時，復乞是願：『願我於彼世尊所有弟子之中，得天眼者，我為第一。』
translation: At the time, he also asked this vow, 'May I be the first among all the Bhagavān's disciples to attain the divine eye.'

source_sentence: 由彼業報，今於我法聲聞弟子，得天眼中，其第一也。
translation: Because of the results of that karma, now I'm the first among the disciples of the śrāvakas in the Dharma to attain the divine eye.

source_sentence: 「汝諸比丘！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 摩尼婁陀，昔有如是種殖善根，由彼業力，今得出家，受具足戒得羅漢果。
translation: Manilūṭa, having planted such a variety of good roots in the past, and because of the power of his actions, he now leaves home, receives the full set of precepts, and attains the fruit of the arhat.

source_sentence: 汝諸比丘！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 我復授記，於我聲聞弟子之中，摩尼婁陀，最為第一。」
translation: I also give assurance that among my śrāvaka disciples, Maṇiluṣṭha is the most eminent."

source_sentence: 復有一時，世尊在於波羅[木*奈]城舊仙居處鹿野苑中，彼時天雨，長老阿難，詣向佛所，頂禮佛足，却住一面，住一面已，白言：「世尊！
translation: There was another time when the Bhagavān was in the Deer Preserve of the old cemetery in Pola [Munai], and it was raining heavens that the elder Ānanda went to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, withdrew to one side, and stayed to one side, saying, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今日天雨，無有飲食，當作何計，令諸比丘過一日夜？」
translation: Today it's raining and there's nothing to eat, so what will you do to make the monks spend the day and night?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「汝莫愁也！
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Don't be sad!

source_sentence: 摩尼婁陀比丘！
translation: Moniruddha bhikṣu!

source_sentence: 現在福力甚強，今日比丘應當得過一日一夜。」
translation: Now, the power of merit is so great that today a monk will be able to spend a day and a night."

source_sentence: 爾時，長老摩尼婁陀詣向佛所，到已頂禮，却住一面而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the elder Maṇiluṣṭha went to the Buddha, paid homage when he arrived, withdrew to one side, and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今者受我微供，若食我食，堪令一切諸比丘等過一日夜。」
translation: Now, if you accept my humble offerings and eat my food, you'll be able to keep all the monks and others occupied for a day and a night."

source_sentence: 於時，世尊默然受許。
translation: The Bhagavān then quietly accepted.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老摩尼婁陀，於晨朝時，著衣持鉢，往至入彼彼羅[木*奈]城。
translation: At the time, the elder Manilūṭa, dressed in his robe and carrying his bowl, went to enter that [wooden] city in the morning.

source_sentence: 其入城已，未曾告乞，亦更無有親舊識知。
translation: After he entered the city, he hadn't asked for alms, and he didn't know anyone close or old.

source_sentence: 當於爾時，忽然即有五百釜食，來至彼前。
translation: At that point, suddenly, five hundred pots of food arrived.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老摩尼婁陀，尋時送彼五百釜食，向鹿苑中，即敷諸座，敷設已訖，往白佛言：「世尊時至，飯食已辦，唯願就食。」
translation: The elder Moniruddha then took those five hundred pots of food and went to the Deer Preserve, where he prepared the seats. After they were prepared, he went to the Buddha and said, "Bhagavān, this food is ready; please eat it!"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊日在東方，著衣持鉢，共諸比丘，來至食堂，於所敷設，次第而坐。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was in the east by sunrise, wearing his robe and carrying his bowl, and he and the monks came to the dining hall, spread out their seats, and sat down in order.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老摩尼婁陀見佛及僧次第坐已，奉持如上五百釜食，施佛及僧，恣飽滿已，然後自食。
translation: After he saw the Buddha and the saṃgha sitting in order, the elder Manilūṭa offered to give the Buddha and the saṃgha the above five hundred pots of food, and after they were satisfied, he then ate for himself.

source_sentence: 飯食亦訖，共諸比丘，詣向講堂，敷座而坐。
translation: When the meal was finished, he and the monks went to the discussion hall, spread out their seats, and sat down.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老摩尼婁陀坐已即告諸比丘言：「諸長老輩！
translation: After he had sat down, the elder Moniruddha addressed the monks, saying, "Elders!

source_sentence: 希有希有！
translation: I wish I had! I wish I had!

source_sentence: 未曾得見如此之事，乃有如此多大果報，多大功德，多大威勢。
translation: Never before has such a thing been seen, yet it has such great rewards, great merits, and great authority.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸長老輩！
translation: elders!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，久遠之時，波羅[木*奈]城有一貧人，無有資財，不立倉庫。
translation: I think back in the distant past, there was a poor man in the city of Pola [munai] who had no possessions and didn't build a warehouse.

source_sentence: 於彼之時，波羅[木*奈]城，有辟支佛，依倚而住，名婆斯吒。
translation: At the time, there was a pratyekabuddha in Pola [munai] who lived on a support called Vasiṣṭha.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，其城穀貴，人民飢饉，乏少者多，其城內外，多有人死，唯見白骨，處處狼籍。
translation: At the time, grain was expensive in that city, the people were starving and lacking in resources, and many people died inside and outside the city, except for white bones, which were scattered everywhere.

source_sentence: 於彼之時，諸出家人，乞食難得，以飢所逼，不能修道。
translation: At the time, it was difficult for renunciant monks to obtain alms, and they were forced by hunger to cultivate their religious practice.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，彼辟支佛，於晨朝時，日在東方著衣持鉢，入波羅[木*奈]次第乞食，遍歷彼城全無所得，如本洗鉢，還出城去。
translation: At the time, that pratyekabuddha, when he was in the east in the morning, put on his robe and took his bowl into Bālā [munay] to solicit food in order, went all over that city and got nothing, washed his bowl as before, and left the city.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，見婆斯吒辟支佛尊，詣向彼邊，到已白言：『善哉大仙！
translation: At the time, I saw Venerable Vasiṣṭha Pratibhāna heading that way, and when he arrived, he said, 'Good, great man!

source_sentence: 此處乞食，頗得已不？
translation: Would it be possible to beg for food here?

source_sentence: 彼尊報我，作如是言：仁者！
translation: The venerable one looked at me and said, "Sir!

source_sentence: 我今乞食不得？』
translation: Am I not allowed to beg for food now?'

source_sentence: 我於爾時，復白彼尊，作如是言：『尊者！
translation: At the time, I again said to the Bhagavān, 'Venerable!

source_sentence: 若然，來至我家。』
translation: If that's the case, come to my house.'

source_sentence: 於時家內，唯有一升稗子熟飯，我即喚彼辟支佛尊，命入舍內將彼稗飯，以用奉施。
translation: At the time, there was only a liter of cooked rice made from barley in my house, so I called that venerable Pratibhāna Buddha and ordered him to go into my abode and give that barley rice as an offering.

source_sentence: 時辟支佛，受我施已，隨意所去。
translation: After accepting my gift, the Vairocana Buddha went away as he pleased.

source_sentence: 我於彼時，為採薪柴，出至城外，與尸陀林，相去不遠，採取柴木。
translation: At the time, I was gathering firewood, so I went outside the city and gathered firewood from the Śītā Forest, which was not far from me.

source_sentence: 彼林有一白骨屍骸，忽然起來，抱我項住。
translation: In that forest, a white corpse suddenly rose up, hugged me, and stayed there.

source_sentence: 我於彼時，欲脫彼屍，慇懃用力，不能得脫。
translation: At the time, I wanted to get rid of that corpse, but I tried hard, but I couldn't get rid of it.

source_sentence: 我於彼日，日落西下，將欲沒時，抱持死屍，來入城內。
translation: On that particular day, when the sun was setting and the sun was going down in the west, I took the dead body in my arms and went into the city.

source_sentence: 我入城時，人見我者，而告我言：『咄人何故將此骨屍，而入城內？』
translation: When I entered the city, someone who saw me said to me, 'Why did you bring this corpse of bones into the city?'

source_sentence: 我報彼言：『是諸人輩！
translation: I replied to them, 'Yes, you people!

source_sentence: 我今盡力，欲脫此屍，了不能得。
translation: Now, I've tried my best to get rid of this corpse, but I haven't been able to.

source_sentence: 汝等若有堪能脫者，當為我脫。』
translation: If there's anyone among you who can get rid of it, you will do it for me.'

source_sentence: 時彼人輩，詳共捉此骨屍牽挽，盡力望脫，亦不能得。
translation: That group of people then took this corpse of bones and pulled it along with them, hoping as hard as they could to get rid of it, but they couldn't.

source_sentence: 我時漸漸至於家內，望欲脫彼白骨死屍，而彼白骨，悉變成金，自然墮地。
translation: I gradually went to my house, hoping to free that white-bone corpse of death, but the white bones all turned into gold and naturally fell to the ground.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，作如是念：『我以此金，不可獨用。』
translation: At the time, I thought, 'This is gold that I can't use alone.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即詣向彼梵德王邊白言：『大王！
translation: After that thought, I went over to that King Brahmā and said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，我今地得伏藏，大王受取，用為國寶。』
translation: 'You should know that I have now attained a hidden treasure in this land that the king will accept and use as a national treasure.'

source_sentence: 時梵德王，喚諸左右而勅之言：『汝等當須隨此人去，其人指授，悉皆受取，將來向此。』
translation: King Brahmā then summoned his retinue and commanded them, 'You must follow this man, and he will instruct you to take it from him and return to this place.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，左右聞王勅已，即時共我來至家內，我即以金，示彼使人。
translation: "After hearing the king's command, his men immediately came with me to my home, and I showed the messenger the gold.

source_sentence: 「爾時，使人還見死屍白骨如故，見已謂我：『咄哉癡人！
translation: "The messenger then saw the dead body with its white bones as before and said to me after he saw it, 'My goodness, you fool!

source_sentence: 汝不癲狂！
translation: You're not crazy!

source_sentence: 何故持彼死屍白骨以為金也？』
translation: Why would you take the white bones of a dead corpse and use them as gold?'

source_sentence: 而彼使者還至王所，具說前事。
translation: The messenger then returned to the king and explained the previous events.

source_sentence: 我於後時，復至王邊而白王言：『大王！
translation: At some point later, I went back to the king and told him, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，我得伏藏，事實不虛，惟願大王！
translation: You should know that it's true that I've attained ambrosia, may it please the great king!

source_sentence: 早為納受。』
translation: You should have accepted it earlier.'

source_sentence: 時梵德王，遂即自往至其家內，見彼金藏，還是白骨如本不異，復告我言：『咄哉癡人！
translation: King Brahmadatta then went to his house and saw his gold treasury, which was still white as the original bones, and told me, 'What a fool!

source_sentence: 汝著癲狂！
translation: You're crazy!

source_sentence: 何為於此白骨死屍而作金想？』
translation: Why do you think of gold in these white bones and dead corpses?'

source_sentence: 我復白彼梵德王言：『大王！
translation: Again, I said to King Brahmā, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，此實金也，非是屍骨。』
translation: You should know that this is really gold, not bones of a corpse.'

source_sentence: 如是再三，作是語已。
translation: After saying this three times, I made this statement.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，手執彼金，作是誓言：『若此金寶，為我來作善業報者，願梵德王亦如是見。』
translation: I then held that gold in my hand and made this vow, 'If this gold and treasure were to create the results of good actions for me in the future, may King Brahmā also see it that way.'

source_sentence: 作此誓已，時梵德王看此死屍，還如我見金寶不異，即告我言：『善哉仁者！
translation: After making this vow, the king of Brahmā looked at this dead corpse and saw it no differently than I had seen the gold and jewelry, and he told me, 'Good, sir!

source_sentence: 汝作何等善業因緣？
translation: What are the causes and conditions of your good actions?

source_sentence: 曾事何神？
translation: What gods did you serve?

source_sentence: 供養何天？
translation: What celestial is offered?

source_sentence: 供養何仙？
translation: What sage should I make offerings to?

source_sentence: 而能與汝如是願也。』
translation: I'm sure I can grant you such a vow.'

source_sentence: 我於爾時，白梵德王作如是言：『大王！
translation: At the time, I said to King Brahmā, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，有一仙人，我曾供給此仙人食。
translation: 'You should know that there's an immortal person to whom I once gave food.

source_sentence: 必應是彼神力所致，令我今日得是果報。』
translation: It must be the result of his spiritual power that caused me to attain this result today.'

source_sentence: 時梵德王而告我言：『汝以造作如是善業，故於今日得此果報。
translation: King Brahmadeva then told me, 'Because you did such good actions, you've attained this result today.

source_sentence: 汝此果報，無人能奪，從今日後，不須疑慮，隨意而用。』
translation: There's no one who can take this reward from you, so from now on, don't be concerned about it; use it as you like.'

source_sentence: 諸長老輩！
translation: Elders!

source_sentence: 我於彼時，正以布施彼辟支佛一食之業，現於爾時即獲果報，所須資財，隨意即辦。
translation: At the time, I was bestowing a single meal on that pratyekabuddha, and now I'm reaping the rewards, acquiring whatever necessities I need at will.

source_sentence: 正以施彼一食之故，七反生於三十三天，受其福報，乃於彼處三十三天，作帝釋王，復於人中，而為國王，并復得作轉輪聖王，治四天下，為世界主，護持世間，七寶具足，乃至降伏，如法治化。
translation: It was precisely because I gave that person a single meal that I was reborn seven times in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven and received its merit that I became the Śakra King there in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, the king of another kingdom among humans, the wheel-turning sage king who rules the four worlds, is lord of the world, protects the world, is replete with the seven treasures, and subdues and disciplines people according to the rules.

source_sentence: 由彼布施一食果報，命終生天，從天下生在於人間；命盡復得生於天上。
translation: As the result of his generosity and the result of a single meal, he'll be born in heaven at the end of his life, and from that world he'll be born among humans; at the end of his life, he'll be born again in heaven.

source_sentence: 流轉如是，更不雜生。
translation: They'll go from strength to strength like this, and there'll be no more mixed birth.

source_sentence: 我所生處，恒得最勝上妙宮殿，若生人間，生豪貴家，資財豐足，乃至一切無所乏少；如在天身，多受快樂，下生人間，亦復如是。
translation: Where I'm born, I'll always attain the most excellent and marvelous palace, and if I'm born among humans, I'll be born into a wealthy family with an abundance of possessions, even if there's nothing lacking; as in the heavenly body, I'll experience many pleasures, and so it will be among humans below.

source_sentence: 以施一食，因彼果報，今生釋種。
translation: By giving a single meal, I'll explain the seeds of their rewards in this life.

source_sentence: 我生之日，諸天下來，將五百寶衣覆我身上，地下復有五百伏藏自然現出，皆以布施一食果報。
translation: On the day I was born, five hundred precious garments were placed over me by people from all over the world, and five hundred hidden treasures naturally appeared beneath the ground, all as the result of giving a single meal.

source_sentence: 我之父母，為我造作三種宮殿：一宜夏坐，二宜冬坐，三宜春秋二時居坐。
translation: My parents built three kinds of palaces for me: one for sitting in summer, two for sitting in winter, and three for sitting during spring and autumn.

source_sentence: 以彼施食果報因緣，我既生於釋種之家，我家爾時，遂即日別漸漸增長，所謂穀米盈溢倉廩，真珠琉璃珊瑚虎魄金銀玉等，無量珍寶，二足四足，無所尠乏。
translation: As a result of the rewards of that kind of giving of food, once I was born into a family of the Śākya lineage, my family gradually grew from day to day, filling the warehouse with rice, real pearls, beryl, coral, tiger skin, gold, silver, jade, and other things of measureless value, and having two or four feet, there was no lack of them.

source_sentence: 又以彼時施食果報，我在園苑，我母爾時，欲試我故，辦具空器，以衣覆蓋，送來與我，至其半路，即有諸天種種飲食，悉滿其器。
translation: At the time, I was in the garden, and my mother, wanting to test me, prepared an empty container, covered it with clothing, and brought it to me.

source_sentence: 彼食香美，大有氣力。
translation: Their food smelled delicious and had great energy.

source_sentence: 又以施食果報力故，共父相隨，撿挍田作。
translation: Because of the power of the rewards of almsgiving, they were accompanied by their father and gathered up the land for work.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，身患飢渴，遂往赴水，掬取欲飲，其水變成天妙甘露。
translation: When he was hungry and thirsty, he went to the water, grabbed it and tried to drink it, and the water turned into the wonderful nectar of the gods.

source_sentence: 又以施彼一食之故果報成熟，今來入此波羅[木*奈]城，未曾與彼委曲相識，自然即有五百釜食，來於我前。
translation: Now, having ripened the fruit of giving them a single meal, I've entered this city of Pola [Munai] before even getting to know them in detail, and naturally, 500 caldrons of food have come to me.

source_sentence: 我受彼食，遣送林中，請佛及僧，供奉此食，悉令佛僧大眾充飽。
translation: I accepted that food, sent it to the forest, invited the Buddha and the saṃgha to serve it, and fed all of the Buddha, saṃgha, and the general public.

source_sentence: 藉彼業報，我於四事，無所乏短。
translation: Because of the results of that karma, there's nothing lacking in the four things I do.

source_sentence: 我施彼食，果業因緣，於世俗樂，亦無所乏；今者出家，於出家樂，亦皆具足。
translation: As a result of my giving that food, there's nothing lacking in the causes and conditions of karma that brings worldly pleasures, and now that I'm a renunciant, I have all the pleasures of renunciancy.

source_sentence: 以彼施食果報熟故，今斷生死，得梵行力，所有作者，皆悉已辦，不受後有，至無畏處，至於前所，當得涅槃，得涅槃已，無樂無苦，自然證知。
translation: Because the results of that food are ripe, I've ended birth-and-death, attained the power of the religious practice, fulfilled all of its causes, gone to the fearless place of no subsequent existence, and reached the former place where I'll attain nirvāṇa, and after attaining nirvāṇa, I'll naturally realize that there's no pleasure and no suffering.

source_sentence: 諸長老輩！
translation: Elders!

source_sentence: 我於彼時，乃不識是辟支世尊，我若決定知辟支佛，我應尋時更求勝果，求大威德，應求無上廣大果報。」
translation: At the time, I didn't know that he was the Vairocana; if I had known for certain that he was the Vairocana Buddha, I would have looked for another time to seek superior results, seek great authority, and seek the unsurpassed and vast rewards."

source_sentence: 爾時，長老摩尼婁陀說前語已，重說偈言：「我自思惟往昔時，　　依住在於波羅[木*奈]，　負賣薪柴以為業，　　值遇尊者婆斯吒，　見已布施一飡食，　　故生豪貴釋種姓，　其名號曰尼婁陀，　　善解音聲復能舞，　拍手歌詠諷頌等，　　并及一切諸技藝。
translation: After he had spoken those words, the elder Manilūṭa then repeated the verse, saying, "I myself think about a time in the past when I was depending on my residence in Bālā [muna*na], selling firewood for a living, and then I met the Venerable Vasiṣṭha, who saw me giving a meal, and I was born into a noble, noble, noble, noble family named Niruddha, who well understood sounds and could dance, clapped my hands, sang, chanted, chanted, and did all sorts of other things.

source_sentence: 我今已自知宿命，　　及以昔世所生處，　往於三十三天上，　　於彼七反往來生，　彼處或作釋天王，　　及以自在天宮內，　一切隨我所造作，　　如是治化於諸天。
translation: Now, I've known my past life and where I was born in the past, and I've gone up to the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven and been reborn there seven times, where I might be the king of the Śākyas and inside my own palace in the heavens, doing whatever I want to do to govern the heavens in this way.

source_sentence: 復經七反作人主，　　灌頂成就剎利王，　自在大力降伏眾，　　不行刀兵諸戎仗。
translation: After seven more rebirths as a human lord, he attains consecration as King Śāriputra, has sovereign power to subdue multitudes, and doesn't fight with swords or armies.

source_sentence: 如法治化大地中，　　多有無量諸珍寶，　於我境界悉豐饒，　　所生家中大巨富，　資財增長無有數，　　於諸人中最為首。
translation: Thus, in the great land created by the rule of law, there are measureless treasures that are abundant in my realm, great wealth in the homes they birth, and an increase in possessions that's incalculable, making them the best of all people.

source_sentence: 世間五欲悉圓備，　　七寶諸珍無闕少，　皆由我作如是業，　　不曾生於惡道中。
translation: The five worldly desires are all complete, and there's nothing missing from the seven treasures, all because I did this kind of activity and wasn't born in a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 今於釋種得出家，　　得三解脫甘露處，　我為何故得出家，　　棄捨家業來於此？
translation: Now, having attained home in the Śākyas, I've attained the place of the ambrosia of the three liberations. Why did I leave home and abandon my family karma to come here?

source_sentence: 正以我獲彼利益，　　故來報佛世尊恩，　世尊知我機熟時，　　為我演說無常法。
translation: It's precisely because I've received their benefits that I've come to repay the Bhagavān for his kindness, and the Bhagavān knows when I'm ripe for it and explains the teaching of impermanence for me.

source_sentence: 若有意所幻化身，　　神通自來至我所，　若我心中有疑惑，　　如是皆悉為我解。
translation: If there's an illusory transformation body with a purpose, the supernormal powers will come to me on their own, and if I have doubts or confusions in my mind, they'll all be explained for me like this.

source_sentence: 佛所說法無分別，　　還為我說無別法。
translation: There's no discrimination between what the Buddha teaches and what he teaches me about nondiscriminating things.

source_sentence: 我今得聞彼實語，　　如法愛樂而奉行，　如是即得三解脫，　　即是仰報諸佛恩。
translation: Now, I've heard his true words, loved and approved of them according to the teaching, and thus attained the three liberations, which is how I look up to the buddhas for kindness.

source_sentence: 我今不樂此命終，　　亦不愛樂此壽命，　但我所受業至時，　　正念思惟當捨壽。
translation: Now, I don't long for this life, and I don't long for this life, but when the karma I've received reaches its end, I correctly contemplate that I will end my life.

source_sentence: 我知未來生死處，　　眾生往來處亦知，　既知此處命終已，　　亦知往至彼處生。
translation: I know the place of future birth and death, and I also know the places where sentient beings will go and come, and since I know that my life will end here, I also know that I'll go to another place for birth.

source_sentence: 毘舍離境竹林村，　　我於彼林當捨壽，　於彼林中蔚茂處，　　漏盡其下入涅槃。」
translation: In the bamboo grove of Vaiśālī, I will spend my life there, and in the luxuriant part of that grove, I'll end the contaminants and enter nirvāṇa beneath it."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊以淨天耳過於人耳，聞彼長老摩尼婁陀，說此過去造業因緣，今昔獲得如是果報。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān, with purified divine ears more than human ears, heard that elderly man Manilūṭa tell him about the causes and conditions of this past action that had led to such a result in the past.

source_sentence: 復以妙偈，而陳說之。
translation: Again, he explained it in a wonderful verse.

source_sentence: 聞是事已，讚歎欣然。
translation: After hearing this, he praised and rejoiced.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經阿難因緣品第六十
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Ananda's Causes and Conditions, Chapter 60

source_sentence: 又於一時，長老阿難，被諸梵行大德人輩勸請，令彼奉侍世尊。
translation: One time, the elder Ānanda was urged by a group of great virtuous men of religious practice to serve the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 從爾已來，盡心盡力，意行調適，如來所說，悉皆受持。
translation: Since then, he's done his best, adapted his mind and actions, and has accepted everything the Tathāgata has taught him.

source_sentence: 從如來口所聞之事，或世間事、或出世事，悉能受持，永不忘失，若有人來諮問所疑，亦悉能令彼心歡喜。
translation: They could always retain the things they heard from the Tathāgata's mouth, whether worldly or supramundane, and never forget them, and if someone came to ask about a doubt, they could always make their heart rejoice.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，世尊集眾，告諸比丘，作如是言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: For these reasons, the Bhagavān gathered the crowd and addressed the monks, saying, "You monks!

source_sentence: 於我聲聞弟子之中，多聞利智，侍者之內，阿難比丘是其人也。」
translation: Among my śrāvaka disciples, the well-versed and intelligent monk Ānanda is one of them."

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The monks then said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 長老阿難，於往昔時，造何善根？
translation: Sr. Ānanda, what good roots did you create in the past?

source_sentence: 藉彼善根，今生釋種大豪姓家，巨富饒財，大有勢力，乃至一切無所乏少。
translation: Thanks to those good roots, I'll be born into a great family of noble men of the Śākyas, with great wealth and possessions, great power, and nothing lacking in everything.

source_sentence: 復以何業？
translation: What other activity will it be based on?

source_sentence: 今得出家，受具足戒，得諸聖法，若聞世間出世間事，永不忘失，若有諸人來問所疑，亦悉能令彼心歡喜。
translation: Now that he's left home, received the full precepts, and attained the noble principles, if he hears about worldly and transmundane matters, he never forgets them, and if people come to him with questions, he's always able to make his mind rejoice.

source_sentence: 世尊復記謂諸比丘：『若知於我聲聞弟子，多聞智慧強記不忘最第一者，此即阿難比丘是也。』」
translation: The Bhagavān then remembered telling the monks, 'Suppose you know that among my śrāvaka disciples, this is the monk Ānanda who's well-versed, wise, and has a strong memory that's not forgotten, and he's the best.'"

source_sentence: 作是語已，佛告諸比丘：「我念往昔，過去世中，久遠之時，還於此處波羅[木*奈]城，有王治化，名曰梵德。
translation: After saying this, the Buddha addressed the monks, "I remember a time in the past, long ago, when I was back in this place, in the city of Pola [Mok*Nai], there was a king who ruled and educated people named Brahmā.

source_sentence: 彼王爾時，生於二子，一名喜根，二名婆奴(隋言月)。
translation: At the time, that king gave birth to two sons, one named Kegan and the other named Banu (Sui term for moon).

source_sentence: 二子之內，喜根為大。
translation: Of the two sons, Kigen was the elder.

source_sentence: 其大子者，本性調善，賢直柔和，多有慈心，畏懼諸罪，厭離愛有。
translation: The older son is by nature well-adjusted, virtuous, straightforward, and gentle, often compassionate, fearful of sins, and disgusted with craving for existence.

source_sentence: 其彼王子，見其城內為諸王事之所逼切，縣官苦惱，殺害無窮，多有繫閉，所謂枷鎖杻械囹圄，地牢固禁，斬截手足，割其耳鼻，挑其眼目。
translation: That prince sees his city being stifled by the king's affairs, afflicted by magistrates, killing and injuring without limit, and often confined, called chained, handcuffed, imprisoned, grounded, amputated, hand and foot, cut off his ears and nose, and picked out his eyes.

source_sentence: 既見此事，遂作是念：『我之父王，百年已往，我身云何當治王位？
translation: Seeing this, they then thought, 'My father the king passed away a hundred years ago, so how will I rule the throne?'

source_sentence: 我今知用如此王位，欲作何事？
translation: Now, what do I want to do with this position of king that I know I'm using?

source_sentence: 及我身命，亦知何用？
translation: Do we know what use we'll make of our lives?

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: What is the reason?

source_sentence: 今見一切諸眾生輩，以種種苦逼切其身。
translation: 'Now, I see all sentient beings who are forced by various kinds of suffering to abandon their bodies.

source_sentence: 如我今者，不如捨家出家修道。』
translation: Now, like me, I might as well leave home and go out to cultivate my religious life.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，詣父母邊，白言：『父母！
translation: After this thought, he went to his parents and said, 'Parents!

source_sentence: 我欲捨家出家修道。』
translation: I want to leave home and train as a monk.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，父母報其子言：『汝身是我所愛之子，不離心意，瞻看無厭，我等寧死，不能別汝。
translation: "It was then that his parents reported to their son, "Your body is my beloved son, and it doesn't part from my mind; I'd rather die than part with you.

source_sentence: 我等但使身命存在，終不相放。』
translation: We'd rather die than part with you. We'll only allow our bodies and lives to exist, and we'll never let go of them.'

source_sentence: 如是再過，喜根童子，白父母言：『父母當知！
translation: After this and that, the boy Śrīgupta said to his parents, 'Parents, you must know!

source_sentence: 我今必定捨家出家，唯願父母！
translation: Now, I will surely leave home and renounce the world, but I only wish for my parents!

source_sentence: 哀愍許我。』
translation: 'Kindly allow me.'

source_sentence: 如是數數諮請父母，而彼父母，遂即聽許捨家出家，而告之言：『汝是我子，如汝所樂，隨汝意也。』
translation: Thus, he repeatedly consulted his parents, who then agreed to leave home and leave the world, telling him, 'You are my son; do as you like, as you wish.'

source_sentence: 爾時，梵德喜根王子，以其父母許得出家，至於他日，捨家剃髮，次第修道而悟緣覺，能作神通變化之事，放光放水，迴天動地，興雲致雨，如是等事，皆悉能辦。
translation: It was then that Prince Śrīgarbha, who had been permitted by his parents to leave home, renounced his family and shaved his hair until another day, cultivated in order and became enlightened, capable of performing miraculous transformations, emitting light and water, reshaping the heavens and moving the earth, producing clouds and rain, and so forth, was able to do them all.

source_sentence: 彼辟支佛作如是念：『我為何事而得出家？
translation: That pratyekabuddha had this thought, 'What was it that made me leave home?'

source_sentence: 如是之事，我今已辦，已得己利，所作已辦。
translation: 'Now, I've done this sort of thing, and I've attained my own benefit, having done it.

source_sentence: 我今可往本生之地，憐愍父母諸眷屬故，及餘眾生，令作福田。』
translation: Now, I can go to my native land and have compassion on my parents, my retinue, and the rest of sentient beings, so that I can be a field of merit.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，喜根辟支世尊，次第遊行，至波羅[木*奈]，至彼國已，依住彼城父王梵德菴羅林內。
translation: "At the time, the Bhagavān, who was delighted with his roots, traveled in procession to Bālā [munay], and when he arrived in that country, he relied on his father, King Brahmā's mango grove, to stay there.

source_sentence: 「爾時，梵德傳聞他說：『喜根童子，已成大仙，還來於此，住我境界。』
translation: "It was then that Brahmadevas heard him say, 'Boy Śrīgupta, you've become a great sage, come back here and stay in my realm.'

source_sentence: 『我今可往至喜根邊，顯現於彼，問訊慰喻。』
translation: 'Now, I can go to Himegan, show up there, and ask about him and explain to him.'

source_sentence: 時梵德王，以大勢力，嚴盛威風，示現神德，從城而出，有四兵眾，前後圍遶。
translation: Then, King Brahmadatta, with great power and dignified dignity, showed his great qualities and emerged from the city, surrounded by a crowd of four soldiers.

source_sentence: 「爾時，喜根尊者辟支，遙見父來，而作是念：『此諸人輩！
translation: "At the time, Venerable Pṛthivī, of the faculty of joy, saw his father coming from a distance and thought, 'Those people!

source_sentence: 梵德王等，大有威力，我慢貢高，我若隨宜在彼前者，梵德王等必不敬我。』
translation: 'The king of Brahmā's virtue and so forth are so powerful that I'm conceited and arrogant, and if I were to go along with them, the king of Brahmā's virtue and so forth wouldn't respect me.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，飛騰虛空，現諸神變，坐臥經行，半身放烟，半身出火，身上放火，身下出水，示現如是種種神通。
translation: After that thought, he soared through the sky, manifested miraculous powers, sat and lay down while walking through the scriptures, emitted smoke from half his body, produced fire from half his body, emitted fire from his body, produced water from his body, and demonstrated various such supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 「時，梵德王諸臣百官，見彼尊者大聖辟支飛騰虛空現諸神變，彼等見已，作如是念：『我之童子，雖捨王位今得出家，已成大仙，有大威德，有大神通。』
translation: "When the ministers and hundred officials of King Brahmā saw that venerable, great sage Pratibhāna, soaring through the sky and displaying miraculous powers, they thought, 'My boy, who left the king's throne and has now left home, has become a great sage, has great authority, and has great supernormal powers.'

source_sentence: 其心爾時，即大歡喜，踊躍無量，遍滿其體，不能自勝，詣彼喜根辟支佛所。
translation: At that point, his heart was overjoyed, and he leaped incalculably, unable to overcome himself as he filled his body, and went to that joyous pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 王既漸進，佛復下空，王到其所，歡喜敬仰。
translation: As the king gradually advanced, the Buddha again descended into the sky, and the king rejoiced and venerated him as he reached him.

source_sentence: 時辟支佛，下住地上，即便坐於所敷之座。
translation: The pratyekabuddha then descended to the ground and resumed sitting on the seat that had been spread out.

source_sentence: 「爾時，梵德到辟支邊，頂禮佛足，却住一面，坐一面已。
translation: "At that point, the Brahmadeva went to Pṛthivī, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, withdrew to one side, and sat down at one side.

source_sentence: 時辟支佛，少說諸法，令王歡喜踊躍無量，顯示善事。
translation: Pārśva then spoke a few words about the Dharma, causing the king to rejoice and dance incalculably, and showed him good deeds.

source_sentence: 「爾時，大王從辟支佛，聽聞法已，歡喜踊躍，白辟支言：『善哉大仙！
translation: "After hearing the Dharma from Vairocana, the king rejoiced and jumped for joy, saying to Vairocana, 'Good, great man!

source_sentence: 今受我請，常住我家，我為尊者，當作伽藍經行房窟，四事供養，心所樂者，悉皆辦與。
translation: Now, accepting my invitation to stay at my house, I, the venerable one, will make a dwelling for the sūtras and practices of the Kālāma, making offerings in four ways, and giving whatever my heart desires.

source_sentence: 若欲哀愍諸眾生故，村落城邑，欲行乞食，任意所行，我不障礙。』
translation: If I want to have compassion for sentient beings, I won't obstruct villages and towns or beg for food wherever I want to go.'

source_sentence: 辟支佛尊，默然而受父王所請。
translation: That pratyekabuddha quietly accepted his father's invitation.

source_sentence: 於時彼王，見彼尊者喜根緣覺默然受請，即辦種種諸供養具，經行房窟，四事供養，悉持施與，自餘須者，一切辦給。
translation: Seeing that the Venerable Śrīgupta Pratyekabuddha had quietly accepted his invitation, the king then prepared various kinds of offerings, went through the monks' living quarters, made four offerings, and gave them all, and gave him whatever else he needed.

source_sentence: 「爾時，喜根辟支仙人，為欲憐愍諸眾生故，入城乞食，如此之時，即得入城。
translation: "At the time, that joyful-rooted pratyekabuddha wanted to have compassion on sentient beings and enter the city to solicit alms, and when he did, he was able to enter the city.

source_sentence: 其月王子，日別至於喜根仙人辟支佛邊，承事供養，於諸法中，心有所疑，時時往問彼辟支佛。
translation: That prince of the moon goes to the joyful-rooted sage Pratyekabuddha separately from day to day, makes offerings, and asks the Pratyekabuddha about the teachings from time to time when he has doubts in his mind.

source_sentence: 其辟支佛，或被婆奴王子所問，默然不答。
translation: When asked by that prince Banu, he remained silent and didn't answer.

source_sentence: 唯於諸指，出其光炎。
translation: He simply emits a bright flame from his fingers.

source_sentence: 爾時婆奴作如是念：『此辟支佛，大有神通，而無才辯。』
translation: It was then that Vātsīputrīya Banu thought, 'This Pratyekabuddha has great supernormal powers but no eloquence.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，喜根尊者辟支告婆奴言：『婆奴王子！
translation: "At the time, the Venerable Pṛthivī of Kālôdayin addressed Vātsīputra, saying, 'Prince Vāṇu!

source_sentence: 汝來出家，汝今若其不肯出家，我定知汝命終之後必墮惡道。
translation: 'You've come to leave home, but if you refuse to leave home now, I'm sure I'll know that you'll fall into a bad path after your life ends.

source_sentence: 若其出家，汝亦應當成就大仙，有大神通。』
translation: If you do, you will also become a great sage with great supernormal powers.'

source_sentence: 爾時婆奴詣向父母，白如是言：『善哉父母！
translation: It was then that Vātsīputrīya went to his parents and said, 'Good, parents!

source_sentence: 喜根仙人，今已出家，我今意欲隨出家也，唯願父母！
translation: "Sage Rejoicing in the Faculties of Joy, now that he has left home, I would like to follow him there, if only to my parents!

source_sentence: 哀愍許我。』
translation: 'Have mercy on me and allow me.'

source_sentence: 而彼父母，遂不許可。
translation: But his parents then refused to permit him.

source_sentence: 婆奴王子，猶故數數至彼喜根仙人之所，承事供養。
translation: That prince Banu then repeatedly went to that sage of joyful faculties to serve and make offerings to him.

source_sentence: 其辟支佛，復數語彼婆奴王子：『汝當出家。』
translation: That prince Pratibhāna then repeatedly said to that prince Banu, 'You must leave home.'

source_sentence: 婆奴王子復報兄言：『父母今日決不聽我捨家出家，事云何也？』
translation: The Vātsīputrīya prince then again answered his brother, 'My parents would never allow me to leave home and renounce the world today.

source_sentence: 「爾時，王子婆奴面上色相出現，於七日內必當命終。
translation: "At that point, the prince Bhanu's face took on a different appearance, and within seven days he would surely die.

source_sentence: 爾時，喜根辟支仙人告婆奴言：『汝來婆奴！
translation: At that point, the joyful Licchavi replied to Banu, 'You, Banu!

source_sentence: 汝必當須捨家出家。
translation: You must leave home and renounce the world.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 汝熟相現，於七日內必當命終。』
translation: 'Your ripened appearance will surely lead to your death within seven days.'

source_sentence: 爾時婆奴至父母邊白言：『父母！
translation: It was then that Vātsīputrīya went to his parents and said, 'Parents!

source_sentence: 唯願放我捨家出家。』
translation: Please let me leave home and renounce the world.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，喜根辟支世尊，亦即詣向自父母邊，白言：『父母！
translation: "At that point, the Bhagavān, who had joyful faculties, also went to his parents and said, 'Parents!

source_sentence: 汝等當放婆奴出家。
translation: "You will release Vātsī from your home.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 其相出現，七日之內定當命終。
translation: When their features appear, their life will surely end within seven days.

source_sentence: 以此因緣，父母必當與彼別離。
translation: Because of this cause and condition, their parents will surely part with them.

source_sentence: 以是定故，寧放出家，在於法內，取於命終，莫令在家取命終也。』
translation: Because of this certainty, it's better to leave home and obtain your life's end within the Dharma than to obtain it at home.'

source_sentence: 父母報言：『婆奴王子於七日內必取命終，與我別者，我今當許捨家出家。』
translation: The parents replied, 'Prince Banu will surely take his life to end within seven days and part with me; now, I will allow him to leave home and renounce the world.'

source_sentence: 「婆奴王子，當於爾時，即剃鬚髮，著袈裟衣，其出家已，於七日中，供養恭敬，事彼喜根。
translation: "At that point, Prince Banu shaved his hair, put on the reddish-brown robes, and left home to make offerings, honor, and serve his faculty of joy for seven days.

source_sentence: 時辟支佛，教授威儀，過六日已。
translation: Pṛthivī taught him how to conduct himself after six days had passed.

source_sentence: 至其七日，定知命終，哀愍彼故，從坐而起，飛騰虛空，經行坐臥，放烟放火，隱身不現，種種神通。
translation: On the seventh day, he knew for certain that his life would end, so he took pity on him and got up from his seat, soared through the sky, walked, sat, and lay down, emitted smoke and fire, hid himself from view, and had various supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 婆奴仙人，見彼喜根辟支佛尊，於虛空中，現於種種神通變化，見已心生歡喜踊躍，遍滿其體，不能自勝，合十指掌，頂禮向彼辟支佛尊。
translation: When the recluse immortal Banu saw that Prabhūtaratna with joyful faculties appearing in the sky with various supernormal powers and transformations, his heart rejoiced and leaped for joy, filling his body so much that he couldn't control himself, and he bowed his head with his ten fingers and palms to that Prabhūtaratna.

source_sentence: 既頂禮已，發如是願：『願我來世，恒值如是辟支聖人，或勝此者，彼所說法，願我聞已，悉令通解。
translation: After prostrating, he made this vow, 'May I always meet such a pratyekabuddha sage in a future life, or maybe he's better than this one, and may I hear his teachings and make them all understand.

source_sentence: 又願我身，於彼聖人，得為侍者，供養彼聖。
translation: May I myself be an attendant to that saint and support him.

source_sentence: 又願來世，得諸神通，所有威力，皆如此佛，若有來問我之義者，我悉為解，令彼歡喜。
translation: May I also hope that in a future life I'll attain the superknowledges and all the powers of such a Buddha, and if anyone comes to ask about my meaning, I'll explain it for them and make them rejoice.

source_sentence: 又願生生世世之中，不在惡道。』」
translation: May I also hope that in all my lifetimes I won't be in a bad path.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸比丘言：「汝等比丘！
translation: At that point, the Buddha addressed the monks, saying, "You monks!

source_sentence: 若有心疑，於彼之時，婆奴王子，於七日內，供養於彼辟支佛尊，受教法者？
translation: If there's any doubt in your mind, Prince Vātsīputrīya, would you have offered support to that venerable pratyekabuddha and received the teaching within seven days?

source_sentence: 莫作異見，此即阿難比丘是也。
translation: Don't take it differently, for this is the monk Ānanda.

source_sentence: 於彼之時，婆奴王子以歡喜心，供養喜根辟支佛故，以彼業報，今得生於釋種之家。
translation: At the time, Prince Bhanu was joyful and made offerings to the joyful-rooted Pratibhāna Buddha, so as a result of that karmic reward, he was now born into a family of the Śākyas.

source_sentence: 而於彼邊，乞如是願：『願我生生世世之中，不墮惡道。』
translation: At that place, he begged this vow: 'May I be born for generations and not fall into a bad path.'

source_sentence: 以彼業報，所生之處，不曾墮於惡道之中，唯生人天，流轉往反，受大快樂。
translation: Because of the results of their actions, they'll be born in a place where they won't fall into a bad destiny but will be born in a heaven where they'll go back and forth and experience great happiness.

source_sentence: 而於彼時，復作是願：『願我來世，值遇如是教師聖人，或勝此者，彼所說法，願我一聞，即得知解。』
translation: At the time, he also made this vow: 'May I meet such a teacher or sage in a future life, or maybe he's better than this one, and may he teach me a lesson that I'll understand as soon as I hear it.'

source_sentence: 以是業報，今得值我如是教師，又於我邊，而得出家，受具足戒，得諸聖法。
translation: As a result of this action, I've now found such a teacher, and at my side, I've left home, received the full set of precepts, and attained the noble principles.

source_sentence: 其於彼時乞如是願：『願我來世，若當值遇如是教師，我於彼邊，得作侍者，供養彼聖。』
translation: At the time, he asked this vow: 'May I meet such a teacher in a future life, and there I'll be able to serve and support that saint.'

source_sentence: 藉彼業報，今於我邊，得作侍者，供養於我。
translation: By relying on the results of that person's actions, I'll now be able to serve and support them at my side.

source_sentence: 其於彼時，又乞是願：『我於來世，得大神通，得大威力。』
translation: At the time, he also asked this vow, 'In a future life, I'll attain great supernormal powers and acquire great authority.'

source_sentence: 藉彼業報，今得成於如是大聖，得大威力。
translation: By relying on the results of those actions, he'll now attain such great sages and acquire great authority.

source_sentence: 其於彼時，又乞是願：『若有人來問所疑者，我悉為彼分別解說，令心歡喜。』
translation: At the time, he also begged and vowed, 'If someone comes to me with a question, I'll explain it separately for them and make their hearts rejoice.'

source_sentence: 藉彼業報，今日阿難！
translation: By the results of that action, today, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 有人來問心中所疑，皆悉為解，令心歡喜。」
translation: When someone comes to ask about a doubt in their mind, they all understand it and rejoice."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛復告諸比丘作如是言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: At that point, the Buddha again addressed the monks, saying, "You monks!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，久遠之時，波羅[木*奈]城，其城有一大富長者，名曰僧薩陀那(隋言王安)。
translation: I think back in the distant past, there was a great wealthy elder named Saṃsadana (Sui word for king's peace) in the city of Pola [munai].

source_sentence: 其彼長者，大富饒財，多有生業，猶如毘沙天王無異。
translation: That elder was very wealthy and prolific, with lots of productive activity, just like King Vaiśravaṇa.

source_sentence: 家中日別恒有五百辟支佛，來向其家食。
translation: Every day, there are 500 separate pratyekabuddhas who come to his house to feed him.

source_sentence: 其時而有一辟支佛，所持之鉢，下底尖小，如牛乳形，其鉢所安，或在草上，或簾箔上，隨即傾倒，不得安住。
translation: At the time, there was a pratyekabuddha who held a bowl with a small, pointed bottom like a cow's milk, and whose bowl was placed either on grass or on a blind or foil that tipped over and couldn't be placed in place.

source_sentence: 彼時長者僧薩陀那，有一女子，可喜端正，女相具足。
translation: At the time, the elder monk Sadāna had a woman who was pleasant and respectable, with perfect female features.

source_sentence: 其女見彼辟支佛鉢傾倒不住，即自脫釧，奉辟支佛，而白之言：『唯願大仙！
translation: When she saw that pratyekabuddha's bowl tilted and unsteady, she took off her arm, presented it to the pratyekabuddha, and said, 'Please, great sage!

source_sentence: 取此釧用安其鉢下。』
translation: Take this bracelet and put it under your bowl.'

source_sentence: 爾時彼仙為憐愍故，即取此釧，用安其鉢，而彼鉢盂，遂不傾動。
translation: Then, out of pity, that sage took this bracelet and placed it under her bowl, which then didn't budge.

source_sentence: 於時彼女，既見此鉢更不傾動安住釧上，歡喜踊躍，遍滿其體，不能自勝，心發是願：『如此仙人鉢安釧上，不傾不倒，我於來世，所聞如是，若世間事，出世間事，悉令憶持。』」
translation: When that woman saw that the bowl didn't tilt and rest on the bracelet, she rejoiced and jumped for joy, filled her body, and couldn't contain herself, and made this vow: 'When this sage's bowl rests on the bracelet and doesn't tilt or fall, I'll hear of such things in the next life, and I'll make them all be remembered, whether they're worldly or supramundane events.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸比丘言：「汝等比丘！
translation: At that point, the Buddha addressed the monks, saying, "You monks!

source_sentence: 若有心疑，於彼之時，長者家女，今為誰者？
translation: If there's any doubt in your mind, then who was the elder's wife at the time?

source_sentence: 莫作異見，此即阿難比丘是也。
translation: Don't take it differently, for this is the monk Ānanda.

source_sentence: 由於彼時，以歡喜心，自脫手釧，以奉尊者辟支仙人，安置鉢器，因發是願：『如此仙人，以鉢安釧不傾倒故，願我來世，若有所聞，若世間事、出世間事，悉皆憶持，永不忘失。』
translation: With joy, he took off his own armlet and presented it to the Venerable Pārśva, placing it in his bowl. He then made this vow: 'Because this sage has a bowl that fits his armlet and doesn't tilt it, may I in future lifetimes remember whatever I've heard, whether worldly or supramundane, and never forget it.'

source_sentence: 由彼業緣，今所聞事，悉不遺忘。」
translation: Because of those karmic conditions, I won't forget anything I hear now."

source_sentence: 長老阿難比丘，又時日在東方，著衣持鉢，往入舍婆提城乞食。
translation: The elder monk Ānanda, who was also in the east at the time, gathered his robe and bowl and went into the city of Śrāvastī to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 去彼祇樹給孤獨園，猶未至於舍婆提城，於其中間，有一大樹名尸奢波，其樹陰下，多有一切諸婆羅門止息其下。
translation: Before he reached Śrāvastī, there was a large tree named Śīśvabhū in the middle of the Jetavana Anāthapiṇḍada Park, and under its shade there were many brāhmaṇas standing underneath it.

source_sentence: 諸婆羅門遙見阿難來欲到邊，各相告言：「汝輩當知！
translation: When the brāhmaṇas saw Ānanda coming from a distance, they each told him, "You must know!

source_sentence: 此是沙門瞿曇弟子，於諸聰明，多聞之中，最第一者。」
translation: This is the disciple of the ascetic Gautama, who is the most intelligent and well-versed of them all."

source_sentence: 作是語已，阿難便至，白言：「仁者！
translation: After he said this, Ānanda came to him and said, "Sir!

source_sentence: 今請觀此尸奢波樹，合有幾葉。」
translation: Now, please examine this tree Śāriputra and see how many leaves it has in common."

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難觀其樹已，而報彼言：「東枝合有若干百葉，若干千葉，如是南枝、西枝、北枝，皆言合有若干百葉若干千葉。」
translation: After observing the tree, Ānanda then reported to him, "The eastern branch has a number of hundred leaves and a number of thousand leaves, and thus the southern, western, and northern branches are all said to have a number of hundred leaves and a number of thousand leaves."

source_sentence: 作是語已，遂即捨去。
translation: After saying this, he then abandoned it.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼諸婆羅門輩，阿難去後，取百數葉，隱藏一邊，阿難迴已，諸婆羅門於是復問：「仁者阿難！
translation: After Ānanda had left, the group of brāhmaṇas took a hundred leaves and hid them away. After Ānanda returned, the brāhmaṇas then asked, "Good man, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝復來也，乞更觀此尸奢波樹，有幾多葉？」
translation: If you're coming back, how many leaves does this cesspool tree have?"

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難仰觀樹已，即知如是婆羅門等所擿藏葉若干百數，便即報彼婆羅門言：「東枝合有若干百葉，若干千葉，如是南枝、西枝、北枝，亦言合有若干百葉，若干千葉。」
translation: After he looked up at the tree, Ānanda knew the number of hundreds of leaves that such a brāhmaṇa had selected for his collection, and he then reported to the brāhmaṇa, "The eastern branch has a combination of hundreds of leaves and thousands of leaves, and so do the southern, western, and northern branches, which are also said to have a combination of hundreds of leaves and thousands of leaves."

source_sentence: 作是語已，便即過去。
translation: After saying this, they then departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼等婆羅門輩，生希有心未曾有心，各相謂言：「此之沙門，甚大聰明，有大智慧。」
translation: At the time, those group of brāhmaṇas, who had a rare and unprecedented mind, each said, "This ascetic is very intelligent and has great wisdom."

source_sentence: 諸婆羅門以此因緣，心得正信，得正信已，其後不久，悉各出家，成羅漢果。
translation: As a result of this, those brāhmaṇas attained right faith, and soon after attaining right faith, they each left home and accomplished the fruit of the arhat.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有長老分那婆素(隋言井宿)，長老宮毘羅(隋言蛟龍)，長老難提迦等，如是三人，唯得知其出家由緒，不知所生因緣之事，亦不知彼於往昔時，作何業也？
translation: At the time, there was also the elder Pūrṇabhadra (Sui term for well), the elder Kumbhīra (Sui term for dragon), and the elder Nandika, and so forth, but they only knew the reasons for their leaving home and didn't know the causes and conditions that led to their birth, nor did they know what actions they had taken in the past.

source_sentence: 或問曰：「當何名此經？」
translation: Some people have asked, "What will be the title of this sūtra?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「摩訶僧祇師！
translation: He replied, "Great mahāsāṃghika teacher!

source_sentence: 名為大事。
translation: It's called great matter.

source_sentence: 「薩婆多師，名此經為大莊嚴。
translation: "The master of the scriptures named this sūtra Great Adornment.

source_sentence: 「迦葉維師，名為佛生因緣。
translation: "The teacher Kāśyapīya is called the causes and conditions for the Buddha's birth.

source_sentence: 「曇無德師，名為釋迦牟尼佛本行。
translation: "The teacher Dharmôdgata is called the lineage of Śākyamuni Buddha.

source_sentence: 「尼沙塞師，名為毘尼藏根本。」
translation: "The teacher Nisanai is called the root of the Vinaya."

source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第六十
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 60
